just turned 9) but I will send some {{{HUGS}}} your way

Deb

messages.subject: Re: I'm sniveling, I admit..or, lonely and need some Woman/Parent Wisdom

messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Kidgie@... wrote:
>
> Ok, I'm not usually like this...but...I'm asking for help. I
posted a few
> days ago about my teens...and I got a very sweet, private reply
that I saved to
> keep me sane :) (Thank, you, Honey, it meant a LOT to me! <--
there's my
> southern coming out to say hello ;) ) But...wah...lol...I was
hoping someone
> else might also say something? I can take harshness! Perhaps I was
unclear, the
> title was "update" or some such thing, and maybe what I SHOULD
have said was -
> Please Give Me Some Advice Because My Heart is Breaking, or
maybe, Advice,
> Para Mi, Por Favor? :)
>
> I hope I hit send. I'm shy to ask again...because I figure, either
ya'll had
> no idea I needed a reply, or maybe because I kicked my daughter
out I might
> be shunned and excommunicated, or maybe I'm beyond the help of
experienced
> unschoolers. I just SO appreciate the advice and wisdom here...I
can't help but
> ask again.
>
> I hope I hit send...sitting here...contemplating...
>
> Erg.
>
> Karen
>
>


Karen I was thinking about answering you but was catching up on 200
e-mails and thought for sure someone helped you I am going to get
kids ready for bed and then I will write longer.

Hang in there and get a hug from somebody.

Julie

messages.subject: Re: I'm sniveling, I admit..or, lonely and need some Woman/Parent Wisdom
messages.msgSnippet: ~~ I hope I hit send. I m shy to ask again...because I figure, either ya ll  had  no idea I needed a reply, or maybe because I kicked my daughter out I might
messages.messageBody:
~~ I hope I hit send. I'm shy to ask again...because I figure, either
ya'll had no idea I needed a reply, or maybe because I kicked my
daughter out I might be shunned and excommunicated, or maybe I'm
beyond the help of experienced unschoolers. I just SO appreciate the
advice and wisdom here...I can't help but ask again. ~~


I'm glad you brought this up! I think we all got sidetracked onto the
tv discussion. Sometimes a post gets lost in the shuffle and it's
really great to bring it back around if you want feedback.

Would you mind posting the original post again? Remind us what the
exact situation was. Thanks Karen!

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: I'm sniveling, I admit..or, lonely and need some Woman/Parent Wisdom
messages.msgSnippet: Ok, I m not usually like this...but...I m asking for help. I posted a few days ago about my teens...and I got a very sweet, private reply that I saved to keep
messages.messageBody:
Ok, I'm not usually like this...but...I'm asking for help. I posted a few
days ago about my teens...and I got a very sweet, private reply that I saved to
keep me sane :) (Thank, you, Honey, it meant a LOT to me! <-- there's my
southern coming out to say hello ;) ) But...wah...lol...I was hoping someone
else might also say something? I can take harshness! Perhaps I was unclear, the
title was "update" or some such thing, and maybe what I SHOULD have said was -
Please Give Me Some Advice Because My Heart is Breaking, or maybe, Advice,
Para Mi, Por Favor? :)

I hope I hit send. I'm shy to ask again...because I figure, either ya'll had
no idea I needed a reply, or maybe because I kicked my daughter out I might
be shunned and excommunicated, or maybe I'm beyond the help of experienced
unschoolers. I just SO appreciate the advice and wisdom here...I can't help but
ask again.

I hope I hit send...sitting here...contemplating...

Erg.

Karen
